snippet: Indiana Republicans want to prohibit mandatory dues for private-sector workers, and to spur other states’ efforts.
abstract: Indiana Republicans say their top priority is to push through business-friendly legislation known as a right-to-work law, which would prohibit mandatory union dues for private-sector workers; if Indiana enacts law, and sponsors say they have the votes, it will likely spur similar initiatives in other states; critics say such legislation is a direct political attack by Republicans on organized labor.
lead_paragraph: Indiana Republicans want to prohibit mandatory dues for private-sector workers, and to spur other states’ efforts.

headline.seo: A Gathering Storm Over ‘Right to Work’ in Indiana
headline.main: A Gathering Storm Over ‘Right to Work’ in Indiana
